meanings.definition: Capable of being adjusted or changed in pitch or frequency.
meanings.sent1: The radio had a tunable knob to change the station easily.
meanings.sent2: Musical instruments often have tunable strings for different sounds.
meanings.sent3: I tried to make my voice tunable like a robot, but it just sounded funny.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was as tunable as a guitar string, changing with every little thing.
meanings.sent5: The tunable colors of the sunset painted the sky in a breathtaking display.

meanings.definition: Able to be fine-tuned or modified for optimal performance.
meanings.sent1: The engine was designed to be tunable for maximum efficiency.
meanings.sent2: Computer settings are often tunable to suit individual preferences.
meanings.sent3: His car was so tunable that it practically drove itself!
meanings.sent4: The team's strategy was as tunable as a well-played symphony, adjusting to every opponent.
meanings.sent5: She had a tunable approach to problem-solving, always finding the best solution.
